skeletonlisp.ParserPckg
Class LambdaParser

java.lang.Object
  skeletonlisp.ParserPckg.LambdaParser

public class LambdaParser
extends java.lang.Object

LambdaParser is used to parse lambda-expressions.

Lambda expressions consist of three parts:
the keyword LAMBDA
the variables part: all the variables must be IDs
the body: can be any proper SkeletonLisp expression.

The expressions, thus look like the following:
(LAMBDA (VAR-1 ... VAR-N) BODY)

Method Detail

makeANewLambda

public static Lambda makeANewLambda(java.lang.String exp)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
The method makeANewLambda is used to parse a String representation of a lambda expression into a new Lambda. To do this, makeANewLambda has to parse all the variables into an ArrayList. and the body, and then combine them to produce the desired Lambda expression.

Parameters:
exp - the String representation of the lambda expression
Returns:
a new Lambda that semantically matches exp.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - an Exception is thrown if exp is not a proper SkeletonLisp lambda expressionor if, for some reason, any of the parts of the lambda expression cannot be parsed.

makeVarList

private static java.util.ArrayList<LId> makeVarList(java.lang.String lambdaVars)
                                             throws java.lang.Exception
The method makeVarList creates an ArrayList of all the variables for the Lambda expression.

Parameters:
lambdaVars - contains the un-parenthesized variable part of a String representation of a lambda expression.
Returns:
returns a new ArrayList containing all the variables in the order given.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if either, for some reason, any of the variables cannot be parsed, or any of the variables are not IDs.

lambdaBody

private static LExp lambdaBody(java.lang.String unwrappedLambdaExp)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
The method lambdaBody parses the body of a lambda expression.

Parameters:
unwrappedLambdaExp - the un-parenthesized form of a lambda expression.
Returns:
returns a new LExp that semantically matches exp.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if the original lambda expression does not have a body, or if, for some reason, the body cannot be parsed.
